snippet: The winners of two state races will not be known at least until absentee ballots are counted, but even if Democrats win, fractures in the party could lead to a Republican running the Senate.
abstract: Democrats begin preparing to lead New York State Senate after shocking political establishment with strong performances in number of political races; Republicans hold that uncounted absentee ballots will allow them to retain their majority, and political experts warn that even if Democrats win numerical majority, their membership is so fragmented that they might be unable to win leadership election in the Senate.
lead_paragraph: The winners of two state races will not be known at least until absentee ballots are counted, but even if Democrats win, fractures in the party could lead to a Republican running the Senate.

headline.seo: New York Senate Makeup Is Unclear, but Talk Turns to Which Party Will Lead
headline.main: New York Senate Makeup Is Unclear, but Talk Turns to Which Party Will Lead
headline.print_headline: New York Senate Makeup Is Unclear, but Talk Turns to Which Party Will Lead
